nodes.label: Climate Change
nodes.description: Global shifts in temperatures and weather patterns.

content.summary: Climate change refers to long-term shifts in temperatures and weather patterns, largely driven by human activities, especially the emission of greenhouse gases.
content.key_insight: Transitioning to renewable energy is the most urgent priority to mitigate catastrophic impacts.

nodes.label: Renewable Energy
nodes.description: Energy from sources that are naturally replenishing.

content.summary: Renewable energy technologies like solar and wind are becoming cost-competitive with fossil fuels globally.
content.key_insight: Grid modernization is essential for integrating intermittent renewable sources.

content.summary: The shift towards electric vehicles (EVs) is accelerating, aiming to decarbonize the transportation sector.
content.key_insight: Battery supply chains remain a critical bottleneck for EV scaling.

content.summary: New battery chemistries like Solid-State are promising higher energy density and safety.
content.key_insight: Reducing reliance on rare earth metals is a key research focus.

content.summary: AI systems capable of navigating without human input are evolving rapidly.
content.key_insight: Regulatory frameworks are lagging behind technological capabilities.

content.summary: AI is a general-purpose technology transforming industries from healthcare to logistics.
content.key_insight: Generative AI models are unlocking new paradigms for human-computer interaction.

nodes.label: Grid Modernization
nodes.description: Upgrading electrical grids for new energy types.

content.summary: Smart grids utilize digital communications to detect and react to local changes in usage.
content.key_insight: Decentralized energy production requires bidirectional grid flows.
